column2: GLOBAL MARKETS-Oil & gas mega-merger keeps stocks fizzing LONDON
column3: April 8 Global stocks remained upbeat on Wednesday as a $70 billion mega-deal in the European oil and gas sector stoked the merger and acquisition fever that has gripped investors this week.

column2: FLIR Systems to settle U.S. SEC bribery charges WASHINGTON
column3: April 8 Defense contractor FLIR Systems Inc will pay $9.5 million to settle civil charges that it violated federal bribery laws by financing a "world tour" of personal travel for government officials in the Middle East

column2: U.S. bird flu outbreak accelerates as wild ducks migrate north CHICAGO
column3: April 8 A U.S. outbreak of a deadly strain of bird flu accelerated on Wednesday with the infection of a sixth turkey flock in Minnesota

column2: JPMorgan CEO defends bank size and breadth of product offerings NEW YORK
column3: April 8 Jamie Dimon
column4: chief executive officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co
column6: defended the size and business model of his company
column7: which has been criticized as being too big and complicated.

column2: INSIGHT-Toy business attracts private equity as kids go green and retro NEW YORK
column3: April 8 Striding confidently through Matty's Toy Stop in Manhasset
column7: is the sort of consumer who may hold the fate of the U.S. toy business in her own little fists.

column2: UPDATE 2-Ex-U.S Army colonel tied to Tilton equity firm reaches plea deal April 8 A retired U.S. Army colonel has agreed to plead guilty to negotiating a job with financier Lynn Tilton's private equity firm while also taking steps to ensure a helicopter company it controlled got paid faster by the Department of Defense.
